extendedIngredients.name: apple
extendedIngredients.original: 1 medium apple, diced into ¼” chunks (peeled if desired, I didn't)
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 medium apple, diced into ¼” chunks (peeled if desired, I didn't)
extendedIngredients.originalName: apple, diced into ¼” chunks (peeled if desired, I didn't)

extendedIngredients.name: brown sugar
extendedIngredients.original: 1 cup + 2 tablespoons light brown sugar, divided
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 cup + 2 tablespoons light brown sugar, divided

extendedIngredients.name: butter
extendedIngredients.original: ½ cup + 1 tablespoon unsalted butter, divided
extendedIngredients.originalString: ½ cup + 1 tablespoon unsalted butter, divided

title: Apple Cinnamon Blondies
instructions: Preheat oven to 350F. Line an 8-by-8-inch pan with aluminum foil or parchment paper and spray with cooking spray; set aside.In a small skillet, melt 1 tablespoon of butter. Add 2 tablespoons brown sugar and cut apples. Stir to combine. Let simmer together on low heat for about 5 minutes, until apples are slightly softened. Set aside to cool while you prepare blondie batter.Melt  cup butter in the microwave. Combine remaining brown sugar and melted butter in a large bowl and whisk to combine. Add the egg, vanilla, and whisk to combine. Add the flour, salt, and stir until just combined, taking care not to over-mix. Fold in the cinnamon chips and apples. Pour batter into prepared pan, smoothing it lightly with a spatula or offset knife.Bake for 30 to 40 minutes, or until the bars are set and a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. The edges will be slightly pulling away from sides of pan.Allow the blondies to cool for at least 2 hours before slicing and serving into 16 squares. I like to refrigerate them before cutting to make them easier to cut.They can be stored in an airtight container at room temperature or in the refrigerator for up to 1 week, or in the freezer for up to 3 months.

steps.step: Preheat oven to 350F. Line an 8-by-8-inch pan with aluminum foil or parchment paper and spray with cooking spray; set aside.In a small skillet, melt 1 tablespoon of butter.
Add 2 tablespoons brown sugar and cut apples. Stir to combine.
Let simmer together on low heat for about 5 minutes, until apples are slightly softened. Set aside to cool while you prepare blondie batter.Melt  cup butter in the microwave.
Combine remaining brown sugar and melted butter in a large bowl and whisk to combine.
Add the egg, vanilla, and whisk to combine.
Add the flour, salt, and stir until just combined, taking care not to over-mix. Fold in the cinnamon chips and apples.
Pour batter into prepared pan, smoothing it lightly with a spatula or offset knife.

Bake for 30 to 40 minutes, or until the bars are set and a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. The edges will be slightly pulling away from sides of pan.Allow the blondies to cool for at least 2 hours before slicing and serving into 16 squares. I like to refrigerate them before cutting to make them easier to cut.They can be stored in an airtight container at room temperature or in the refrigerator for up to 1 week, or in the freezer for up to 3 months.
